item.title: The Secret Sauce: How to Connect Your Raspberry Pi to a Hidden SSID
item.description: When I got my first Raspberry Pi Model B (not long after they first became available – remember when they only had 256M?!?), I wanted to configure it to use a wifi adapter. Even with approved, compliant adapters, this wasn’t for the faint of heart; many steps, scripts, and secret incantations were required to get everything to connect, even in the best of circumstances. Fast-forward to today, when wifi adapter drivers are included in the base Raspbian build.
